intro: Coulterella vaseyi, commonly known as the desert sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Coulterella vaseyi is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a minor role in local ecosystems.
